page.title: 02Block ref. 04480453 (Part 2)
page.content: In the North-West corner of this block flows the{River Nidd}a tributary of the {River Ose}which flows through the centre of{York.} A smaller tributary of the Ouse also flows across the South-East corner of the block,{The Foss}although this is little more than a stream. The only topological feature of this block in an otherwise completely flat landscape is{Wilstrop Wood}a small coppice of deciduous trees which is largely maintained as a widbreak for the nearby{Wilstrop Farm} Other windbreaks can be seen along the A59 road (originally of Roman construction). These are the distinctive straight rows of poplar trees alongside farm buildings. These trees have given their name to the nearby villages of{Upper}and{Nether {Poppleton.}
